website_summaries.verdict: The Gogroove FlexSmart X2 is a good option, but not the best, if you're looking for a no-install way to pipe calls and music through your car stereo.
pros: The Gogroove FlexSmart X2 is extremely flexible, offering an easily positioned neck and three different ways to act as a bridge between a smartphone and a car's stereo
A powered USB port makes sure the Bluetooth-paired handset stays charged while in use
cons: Construction of the X2 is a bit iffy in places
Caller ID and voice command are not supported

customer_reviews.title: Charging end broke
customer_reviews.text: This was our second purchase of the Gogroove for cars that did not have built in bluetooth. Both worked well and had quality sound. The first one lasted about 9 months before it broke when the charging area. The second one lasted 4-5 months and broke in the same location. There may be some stress on the device where we were plugging it in to the car lighter port. We used some super glue on the second one and limped along awhile before it broke completely. It is a great product while it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: When it was good,
customer_reviews.text: It was very very good. When it was bad it was useless. We simply couldn't get the FlexSMART to stay tuned on a station. It would work really well on one for a short time (20 seconds, maybe), but static would move in. We tried multiple stations in different places around the neighborhood hoping to get better reception, but nothing worked for long at all. The techie who helped me with it thought maybe it was because the antenna in my 13 yo Civic was in the back window. So disappointed to have to return it.
customer_reviews.author: CDamon

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I have purchase this device for both our family and friends. Perfect device for those of us who have older cars that don’t have Bluetooth connectivity. Pairing is seamless. Sound quality is good. I have to turn the volume on my radio controls up quite a bit when using the hands free for my phone, but the people whom I call seem to be able to hear me just fine. Volume seems to work more efficiently for listening to audio through my phone. Love how it can charge my phone while listening. Does not have a display for showing song information or caller ID. Nonetheless, I am extremely satisfied and would highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great but susceptible to being overpowered by other FM transmitters
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is great as long as you keep the source device volume at or below 85%. Above that, you begin to hear what sounds like over modulation, you can counter it by de-tuning your treble and bass settings on the stereo; but risk diminishing sound clarity. FM transmitter is not very powerful and can be easily overpowered by other Bluetooth FM transmitter devices in adjacent vehicles. Turning the transmitter volume up does help to break through the interference, but in most instances, it just nulls out the other transmissions and all you hear is silence on the radio until the other adjacent vehicle is no longer within close proximity of the FM transmitter.
customer_reviews.author: Charger/Stang Man

customer_reviews.title: Way too much noise.  Will return.
customer_reviews.text: Not so much. The product came with no instructions and only by random poking of buttons and twisting the dial, I finally got it to connect to phone and select a radio frequency. The amount of noise transmitted to the radio made the unit useless. I tried low and high frequencies to no avail. The device itself seemed solid with solid clicks of buttons and selection by rotary dial. But, there was no way it could be considered as passable given the excess noise.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Berfel

customer_reviews.title: Very good product
customer_reviews.text: I got this a replacement for another flex smart transmitter I’ve had for several years. I love the updated look, the led is much easier to read, and there is a knob to set to a radio station which is much more convenient. The volume, as others have mentioned is not as loud as my previous transmitter, I need to crank the radio up really high to hear. Still, the positives outweigh this issue, and I recommend to anyone who wants to update an older car to Bluetooth connectivity.
customer_reviews.author: socalgal

customer_reviews.title: Unable to swivel the unit so the letters/controls are facing the correct direction.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife's 2005 Honda CR-V. We had trouble getting the unit to stay plugged into the power port. Also when plugged in the LED screens were upside down and you can't swivel the unit on its stalk to get them facing the right direction. Also, she had difficulty with the volume: with it turned all the way up she could barely hear me on her phone. All in all, we felt this purchase was a bust.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck B.

customer_reviews.title: Works great with my older car
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2006 Infinity FX35 This unit is the only one that worked. I have tried at least 6 different FM transmitters. They all interfered with my computer. They were rough in sound or had a high pitch sound. I had one of these originally. I had it for several years. Then my daughter needed one. So...I gave her mine. THEN I suffered. :( As now I went on this journey of a million FM transmitters. :\ So...now I have the same make and model as before. I am happy. Thank you Flexmart!
customer_reviews.author: Jo Ann Staples

customer_reviews.title: a good alternative for bluetooth phone calls in a 15 year ...
customer_reviews.text: Works fairly well for my old car. The gooseneck is limited due to the configuration of the dashboard in my car. I saw the upgraded version after I bought this and wished I had purchased that one instead. Still, a good alternative for bluetooth phone calls in a 15 year old car. I am impressed with how easily it connects to my phone (galaxy s5) when I start up the car. I had to search manually for a good "station" to tune it too that will work around town. I live in a small town, so not too difficult.
customer_reviews.author: gneissgirl

customer_reviews.title: I tried some others cheaper ones, but this one is worth the extra money
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful transmitter. I have tried a wired one, did not like it because it always had static and then the thing stopped working after about 6 months. I also tried another bluetooth one here on Amazon and it was not good either. Static almost always and no way to turn on the thing when the car was off. This one is awesome. My brother in law has one and I just bought one for my dad for Christmas. -clear sound -on off switch -USB charging port -very clear while making phone calls -can skip to the next song on pandora with device -connects quick to bluetooth
customer_reviews.author: JJAM

customer_reviews.title: The best so far.....
customer_reviews.text: After wasting money on several different cheaper Bluetooth transmitters, I finally paid double and found this one to be satisfactory. I would have given 5 stars due to the fact it provides excellent sound in the car, but the cigarette lighter adapter fits really tight and has a tendency to fall apart when removed (tip, cap, fuse and spring fall out). Also, I've only had it a few weeks so I can't honestly vouch for its longevity. If it lasts a year, I'll be satisfied as the cheaper ones only survived a few months or less.
customer_reviews.author: G. Carver

customer_reviews.title: Works for Me
customer_reviews.text: So far, I am pleased. My car is practically an antique (a 2008 Accord) lol, so I have no other way to play Spotify on my car speakers that doesn't involve spending money, so this little gadget was worth the small amount I had to spend on it. So far, I have had no issues finding a blank station, either in the city or on a road trip. I was able to listen to it on a 400 mile trip and never lost the signal. I don't use it to talk on the phone, so I can't speak to that, but for my purposes, so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Christy Foreman

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product For Us Drivers with Older Cars
customer_reviews.text: I drive an ‘06 and my boyfriend drives and ‘09. Neither of our cars had the capability of plugging in an aux cord and being able to listen to our music of choice while driving. Purchasing this item was the best decision I made! I first ordered it for myself and my boyfriend fell in love with it so we went ahead and ordered a second for his car too. Super good quality and very affordable price. It’s bluetooth so there’s no wires or cords of any kind needed! It may take a little while to find the right empty station in your area that plays clearly but once you do, you’re all set!
customer_reviews.author: Veronica Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I inherited an older Acura from my folks and the Bluetooth wasn't working. I did not want to pay to fix it and didn't want to buy a whole new stereo but did want to play my music and podcasts from my phone, so gave this a shot. It is perfect. Now I know it depends a lot on the radio stations in your area. But for me, I scrolled over to 88.1 and it's clear as can be.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Randolph

customer_reviews.title: Works great for what I need
customer_reviews.text: I can listen to my music and make/receive phone calls from my android. People say they hear me clearly. Music comes through sounding good. The secret to using these kind of devices that use the cigarette lighter is to find an FM radio channel that you can't hear any talking or music, static is ok. They work best in less urban areas. If you are in an urban area, as I am, try removing the antenna on your car when the device is in use. The more you can do to make the FM reception to your vehicle poor, the better.
customer_reviews.author: coast rider

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Worked out of the box for this non-technical person. Hands free and works really well. Sometimes gets fuzzy as you turn up the volume into the very high range, and periodically (once so far in two months of daily use) someone else's phone or car took over for 30 seconds and blasted their music at me. Very happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, great value
customer_reviews.text: Great functionality, good sound quality for an FM transmitter. In Los Angeles there's barely a clear channel, but it cuts through pretty well. This turns on and gets music going very quickly, and the controls are convenient and easy to use. The ability to link 2 phones and switch between them seamlessly is fantastic when my wife gets tired of my music. I got this for an old convertible so I don't intend to test call quality and don't know about its microphone quality.
customer_reviews.author: Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Welcome to the 21st century!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! My 2001 Jeep Cherokee with cassette player has finally entered the 21st century! I plugged it in, set up my phone and it connected automatically. It really works and it was nice taking a 10 hour road trip and have modern music to listen to! I have been listening to my 30 year old cassette tapes, so this is a serious upgrade. The call quality is good as well, and it does automatically turn the music volume down when a call comes through, or if Google Maps is telling you the next turn. Even on old factory speakers, the sound quality is good when playing Pandora. I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Razorbacks92

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth killed the radio star
customer_reviews.text: I use this in my 2000s-model car that lacks an AUX port. It mostly gets the job done and the sound is decent if I can get the right signal. I like the fact that I can plug my power cable into it and charge my phone while listening to a podcast. A couple of drawbacks: 1) it is supposed to allow 2 phones to connect, but I have not been able to get that to work; 2) the volume control is not easy to use and I often end up inadvertently changing the station if I use it.
customer_reviews.author: Rombies

customer_reviews.title: Will only work when it wants to, don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: After my last bluetooth device broke I decided to go for a different, sturdier looking model. I chose this one, and it was a waste of time. After having to look on youtube so that I could pair this device to my phone (the instruction manual is severely lacking) I thought everything was hunky dory! However, after a few days of musical bliss, it crapped out on me. It would pair to my device, but the transmitter wouldn't transmit to my radio. I tried different stations, but it just wouldn't work. I'm going to ship it back today to get a refund on this piece of junk. $50 for this? No thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Nina

customer_reviews.title: it's great. But that's the problem
customer_reviews.text: When it works, it's great. But that's the problem. You would think that once you mated it with an FM station, blue-toothed the FlexSMART to your phone, you'd be good to go unless you moved into another area where the FM stations are different. But sadly, my device almost never "just connects". I always have to turn it off and on, disconnect and reconnect my phone and the radio station reception changes with the weather. Am I glad I bought it, well yes as there is no other viable option for my old truck. And like I said, when it's working you couldn't ask for better. For the price and lack of alternate solutions, it's good. But it's not magic...
customer_reviews.author: MotoJac

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly for 6 months then stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Bluetooth transmitter to replace the one I had that lasted me for 3 years, same model. In fact my old one still worked partially and I gave it to a friend. However after about 6 months this new one stopped functionning. It no longer plays music from my phone even though it is connected to the phone. Switching channel doesn't help. I tried everything to trouble shoot it without success. I would like to be able to use the warranty since I only bought it 8 months ago but I am unable to get an answer to my emails. Very very disappointed in this product. For the price it should last more than 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: Roxanne1010

customer_reviews.title: Great music in my car = less road rage
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this GOgroove to stream music in my car through my cellphone. It works great, sounds great and could not be easier to setup and use. No more spending most of my time in the car frustratingly scanning through radio stations in search of good music to listen to. I've spent a lot of money building a large music library that I can now enjoy in my car. Driving just became much more enjoyable. UPDATE: Device broke after 9 months of use. The top kept sliding off of the stand, exposing two small wires. Today the wires broke. Very poor design.
customer_reviews.author: T. Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Best FM transmitter I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: I was a little hesitant at first getting a FM transmitter since I live in Chicago where we have a plethora of radio stations to cause interference, and historically have not had the best luck with these. I'm very glad I gave this a try, because this thing is fantastic. Not only the signal quality, but the various features such as bluetooth, pause, skip, back, and the microphone for calls really make the package. Build quality is great too. The only thing I wasn't 100% on is the plug, which fits very snug in my outlet. Taking it in and out worries me a little that I'm going to break something. Would recommend you plug it in and leave it.
customer_reviews.author: Max V

customer_reviews.title: Works, but floopy
customer_reviews.text: It works well. The signal strength seems to be much better than the previous 3 FM transmitters I tried. Much clearer sound. I got this one with the flexible mount because the other Flexsmart with the stationary head sticks out way too far. This one on the flexible stalk is nice, but the head unit flops around. It won't stay where you put it. Not sure if this is normal, or a defect on my unit. Hopefully the seller will comment.
customer_reviews.author: Capt. Nate

customer_reviews.title: The performance is fine if no great change in signals around
customer_reviews.text: Works well as advertised. I have not experienced the stuck and/or disintegrating charging socket. The performance is fine if no great change in signals around, but the proliferation of stations makes it hard to find a single point for reception. Having used the product, while it does what it says, I lose access to the stations I like if I want to receive calls via the device. It would call for a lot of activity that would be potentially distracting to select the appropriate channel and turn on the device when a call is coming in, as opposed to something that would automatically do that for me. I have since gotten a headset that solves that problem for me.
customer_reviews.author: PeterJ

customer_reviews.title: Get this one!
customer_reviews.text: I finally found one that works! I’ve tried a number that didn’t work or were a huge battery suck. This one actually gets the job done. Easy set up, reasonable battery usage for a bluetooth device and the sound is good enough for me to have a conversation over my phone. The one thing is sometimes the sound needs to be cranked up. Some apps also work better than others which I think may be more of an issue with the apps.
customer_reviews.author: Anonjpx

customer_reviews.title: This is the best product ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: The purchase of this product exceeded my expectations! It arrived on time and was pretty easy to assemble. It works perfectly too! With many laws coming into play with regards to no cell phones while driving, I sought a solution to help me comply. It works perfectly, so if you buy one, you won't be disappointed. This product is amazing and the low cost to buy it made it even sweeter. It's worth every penny and then some. I plan to buy several more for family members as well.
customer_reviews.author: cjd

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: This thing has been great...the problem is in my area it seems like every time I think I find a clear station there is another station close enough to cause an issue. Well issue is a bit strong...it works fine when both your radio and flexsmart are tuned to the same station. When turn the flexsmart off you can hear the chatter. Not a major problem hence the 5 star rating. This product to me work great...it is oddly shaped but it can be worked with. Appreciate the usb plug....that comes in handy and the 3.5mm port is nice if you don't have a bluetooth or Wi-Fi enabled mp3 player.
customer_reviews.author: Lonnie Uptegrow

customer_reviews.title: Rock Solid
customer_reviews.text: This is certainly an overall improvement over my previous setup and is well deserving of a very good rating. It produces good sound, Bluetooth connectivity is surprisingly solid and the controls are fairly easy to navigate. There are some small issues with one of the bigger ones just being that is difficult to mold the wire they way I want it to. Phone controls and quality is not the best, but I don’t usually ever talk while driving so it wont be that big of an issue. Bonus points for the USB port which means i can still charge my phone while driving
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Potthoff

customer_reviews.title: ... for about a year now and it's still working beautifully. It was easy to pair my iPhone to ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for about a year now and it's still working beautifully. It was easy to pair my iPhone to the Bluetooth. The only thing I have issues with is answering calls. I have to plug it in towards the bottom of my center console, and the microphone isn't sensitive enough to pick up my voice from that distance. I primarily bought this device for listening to music, so this flaw (due to my car's design, not the product itself) is relatively unimportant to me. I have used the hands free calling feature in a different car where it was plugged in higher up on the dash and it worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Molly W.

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. Pros: -Very easy to set up and connect with. Had no trouble with an iPod, iPad, or my HTC Desire. -Easy to shut off... very simple button at the base of the neck. -Sound is reasonable even when using as a handsfree device. Husband said I sounded "different" but he had no trouble hearing me or understanding what I was saying. Cons: -Only one device can be connected at a time. I have other hands free devices that allow more than one connection so I know it can be done. I use mine all the time... have had it for a while now and have not had any problems with it.
customer_reviews.author: Josi77

customer_reviews.title: A Must-Have!
customer_reviews.text: My first one broke, so I just had to get a new one because I loved it so much. Not sure what happened to the first one to cause it to quit working but I’ve had the new one for 2+ years and it’s worked like a charm, no issues. I use it daily and it does really well with overcoming static, sometimes you need to change the station when going through large cities, but hardly ever. Great product! Perfect for playing Spotify songs and has a port to charge your phone too!
customer_reviews.author: Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Worked good for a while, and then nothing but static
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this one. The display is nice and bright, and with the on/off switch it paired as soon as I turned it on. However, It started to get a lot of static and I would change radio stations and it would be OK, but eventually I could not find any stations that did not have noise. Now its junk
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: Not good for cities.
customer_reviews.text: The city I live in has many radio stations. While the GOgroove works fine when I'm parked, as soon as I drive any distance, I get interference and have to change the frequency. When I'm stuck in a traffic jam, other cars with similar FM transmitters are close enough that I can hear other people's conversations. This device isn't strong enough to block them out. The previous FM transmitter I had, a Jabra Cruzer, had a much stronger transmitter and I didn't have this problem. I got this one because I thought it would be better for music (stereo, two bluetooth devices), but the transmission problems make the GOgroove unusable. I am returning it.
customer_reviews.author: hackerb9

customer_reviews.title: Great Price!  Good product!
customer_reviews.text: I had to return the first one because there were problems with the display. The return was easy. The second one works well and I am thrilled with being able to listen to my music from my iPhone. The sound quality is pretty good. Google “strong available radio stations” in your area to find a good setting. Sound quality is only as good as your speakers and radio station strength. Mine is good and what a great price.
customer_reviews.author: DJB

customer_reviews.title: I saw this as the recommended device for cars that do not have bluetooth settings ...
customer_reviews.text: I have forever been limited to radio stations and carrying 50 CDs in my car for a variety of music, but this is a game-changer! I saw this as the recommended device for cars that do not have bluetooth settings and it has changed my life. Pair this device with Spotify and you are good. The only setback is that, as you are driving, you may need to toggle between radio frequencies to get a clear connection between FlexSMART and your bluetooth device. I personally didn't expect it to be perfect (since I'm trying to adapt an old car with new technology) so I don't mind.
customer_reviews.author: SunshineTop Contributor: Eye Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Still working great after 2 years
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product a couple years ago. Still going strong. It works great. Sometimes there is interference with competing radio stations but it is a fast fix to simply and quickly tune in to a different frequency. The microphone also works great for talking to people while I'm driving. They always hear me clearly. I would much prefer to have a vehicle with built in Bluetooth but this is a good solution for older vehicles.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy from this Company!! They’re a rip off!
customer_reviews.text: I got it for Christmas.. worked great for 3 months then stopped working.. I tried every trick to get it to work again but it’s dead & wont turn on.. I contacted Amazon and they told me to contact the seller. I tried that to No Answer! I emailed & left multiple messages.. never heard from them.. this item is not worth the Money & not good Quality if it only worked for 3months. Customer service is the worst..
customer_reviews.author: airnoz75

customer_reviews.title: - Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because there is no aux port or tape deck in my car. Not thrilled with it. PROS: - Easy to install, you just plug it in - Can change transmit station easily - If you find the right station, as with any other FM transmitter, the sound quality is pretty good. Not excellent, but pretty good. CONS: - The feature that lets you automatically find the best station to transmit did not work on mine. I would have liked this feature a lot. - Instruction manual was exceedingly difficult to use; needlessly confusing - Kind of ugly and the cord is a weird length
customer_reviews.author: Erica H

customer_reviews.title: Amazing little device
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Bluetooth radio transmitter I tried. The first one was awful and was super staticy. This one is very clear and sounds wonderful. I'm using it with a 2006 Miata with the Bose stereo system and a stubby antenna. Super easy to use and setup. It does have a little power on/off button but it does shut off when my car is off.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: This is the One You Want!
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this item for a second time. My first GOgroove FlexSMART worked perfectly for three years until stolen a few weeks ago. My husband realizes now the need to lock the truck when parking at the zoo. But I digress. I have used this with a Samsung Galaxy S3 iPhone4 and iPhone6 Plus and have been extremely happy. Phone calls come through great. I can hear the caller through the vehicle speakers and they have no problem hearing me. It is easy to advance through music tracks without taking my eye off the road. Syncing the phone was easy. This transmitter is a bit pricey, but worth it. Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Aunt JB

customer_reviews.title: Recommended for quick bluetooth fix for an old stereo.
customer_reviews.text: It's the best FM transmitter I've used. They're never going to sound as good as an direct aux. I would say on a good channel it could rival bluetooth. I bought it because I had no other option aside from swapping out the head unit. I am happy with it though. It pairs easily and connects instantly. Actually faster than the bluetooth head unit in my other car. The controls work well. I would recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: ShawnC

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is good IF it's on a quiet channel. Sound quality is no better than the Keedox, perhaps a little worse (though the Keedox quality is poor when detached from the power supply). Good user interface. Pause, answer and hangup buttons are nice. Reconnects automatically when I get in car (Android 4.3) A little hard to plug in, but since it will be staying put that's no biggie Is a little far away in the Prius 2007 - think about where your outlet is located before you purchase Others have mentioned autoscan, but it is not a feature in the one I received.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product, Great customer support!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this about 6-8 months back. The piece that goes into the cigarette lighter broke a few weeks back and would not spring back. Contacted the Seller, 2nd Street Electronics. They very quickly sent me the contact info for the manufacturer, Accessory Power. Accessory Power very promptly got back to me and offered to send me a new Flexsmart power neck(unit is 2 pcs). WOW, what great customer service from both seller and manufacturer! Very refreshing to receive this type of response and support! Two huge thumbs up to both 2nd Street and Accessory Power....BTW, Love the blue tooth GOgroove....great way to add blue tooth capability to an older vehicle!
customer_reviews.author: BO

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding
customer_reviews.text: I'm so over tape deck music players. Having to hear that tick tick tick every second of my car ride. This plays all my stuff straight off my phone with no connection every time I turn it on rubbish. I hear a beep then I my phone's already connected to my car stereo. No thought required. Friends can easily connect to it right inside the car while we drive and quickly play their favorites. I can wait to pick up my daughter and play an episode of Friends through my speakers. It pauses everything when I take a call. If it could cook me breakfast I'd marry it.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Cat

customer_reviews.title: GoGroove Is Awesome & Quality Is Great!
customer_reviews.text: This Product Is Really Easy To Use. The Sound Quality Is Awesome. It's Easy To Bluetooth To A Vehicle. Easy To Navigate For Listening To Your Favorite Songs, & Easy To Use For Having A Conversation While Traveling. I Highly Recommend This Product For Awesome Quality, Easy To Use, & Easy Connection For Bluetooth.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy Roberson

customer_reviews.title: Big improvement over my last FM Transmitter...
customer_reviews.text: Extremely tight fit in the cig lighter - SO BE CAREFUL NOT TO YANK IT OUT. My daughter did with hers and pulled-out the entire lighter and wires from the dash and now her radio has horrible static and is unusable now. We're still getting that checked-out. BUT no problems in my car, awesome sound using bluetooth streaming podcasts or music (Spotify) and Google map instructions when using phone, now come through radio/car speakers.
customer_reviews.author: KLMadison

customer_reviews.title: Love it - would buy again, or for a friend!
customer_reviews.text: Great product - didn't even need the instructions to begin using it. It immediately paired with my Samsung Note 5 and within minutes I received a phone call which I answered via the unit. My caller did not know I was using a bluetooth, wireless speaker. I listen to podcasts and streaming music (FM radio is terrible these days) as I'm driving and this lets me hear through the vehicle speakers. The sound is very clear. Love that the flexible mount allows me to move it out of the way when not in use. I had been thinking of retrofitting my car's audio system - an expensive process - but now I don't have to.
customer_reviews.author: kirpeche

customer_reviews.title: Works well enough.
customer_reviews.text: Some hissing from the audio when you turn up the volume on the flexsmart itself, but keep the flexsmart at about half volume and it's plenty clear. Solid enough, I do think it's a little big and ugly, but the station adjustment is good. LED's are a little bright at night. Controls work just fine at skipping songs in both media player and on pandora. Seattle just sucks with regards to open air. 99.5 worked decently. I wound up just buying and installing a factory AUX jack in my MINI, but this one still works well for music in our ambulance!
customer_reviews.author: Colin S. MartinTop Contributor: Calligraphy

customer_reviews.title: What a genius product
customer_reviews.text: The best thing that I bought for my 1999 Camry. It's really easy to use. In fact, it's so amazing that I bought a copy for my brother's car as well in how easy to set this thing up. One thing to note is that if you want to use another person's phone, disconnect your phone first through the Bluetooth setting on your phone. Then, asked your friend to connect to it through his Bluetooth setting. As that happens, hold the blue call button, and a few seconds later, you can now play this phone through your car speakers. Overall, amazing product
customer_reviews.author: Merry

customer_reviews.title: Loved It!
customer_reviews.text: I used this before I got a new car that had a ll the bells and whistles. But this is amazing. It was so easy to use everyday, I think over the span of two years that I had this I had to change and find a different channel like twice. So that was no problem at all. No static at all while listening and talking on phone calls. I think it actually works better than some built-in Bluetooth systems in cars now.
customer_reviews.author: C. Edwards

customer_reviews.title: FM dial stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I used this product for 2 months. The FM tuner dial is the middle round knob and it has stopped working, so now it's stuck on one channel which makes it useless as there's interference when the outside radio signal is very strong. It does take some time to pair with the phone and sometimes does not detect at all, especially if it's been unplugged (I'm in a high-crime area, so I don't leave it in my car). I have to manually re-pair with my bluetooth about 50% of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this, for the charging ability and the ability ...
customer_reviews.text: Love this, for the charging ability and the ability to listen to spotify in my car! have no idea what is going on on the radio these days. 3 stars for 2 issues. Very often have to change the channel because the sound gets staticky on the station i am already on. and the charging part that is inserted into the car (not sure what that's called either) seems to be flimsy and can fall out easily enough. If i accidentally nudge it whilst driving, it can fall out and turn off the connection. Other than these two things, LOVE THE PRODUCT. I've used a few other bluetooth devices, and this has still been the best.
customer_reviews.author: sv3tik

customer_reviews.title: Limited range, awkward design
customer_reviews.text: Worked okay for streaming audio from iPhone to FM Radio. Limited range - good look remaining connected if you leave the car with your phone in your pocket (and I had a convertible!). Never could get it to connect to the phone for calls, Siri, etc.The mounting mechanism is awkward - my choices were in the center console where it either interfered with the manual transmission shifter or encroached on the passenger seat, or in the passenger side footwell where it was too far away to easily reach to turn on/off, accept/reject calls, etc. Since my model car had continuous power to the cigarette lighters, had to remember to turn it off when away from the vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Clear sound, works great
customer_reviews.text: This GOgroove Fl...t X2 works as advertized, I use it to play music and podcasts from my cell phone thru the car stereo (of course) and it's signal to the car stereo must be very strong because I hear no static. I've used it a couple of times as a hands-free way of talking on the phone while driving and it worked fine. The on/off button is great because I leave the device in the power port that's always on and all I have to do is push the button to turn it off/on. This thing connects to my phone very quick every time. The USB charging port comes in handy too. I couldn't be happier with it.
customer_reviews.author: Tall Tom

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made and Unnecessarily Bulky
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for daily use in my work van. At first I loved the thing, but after a few weeks that turned to disappointment. It started cutting out anytime I went over a little bump in the road, presumably because some part of the wiring was loose. The plastic parts on the control hub also started getting loose. Eventually the cheap rubber piece that helped hold it in the cigarette lighter tore away and it would no longer stay mounted. It has been nearly a year since this stopped working and I haven't bothered getting a different bluetooth transmitter because my experience with this thing was to bad. I'm guessing the top is too heavy for the cheap components.
customer_reviews.author: Joe J.

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: I have always used an auxillary cable and then i purchased a truck without a plug. I then used an aux plug fm transmitter, terrible! the volume fluxuated and would give out completely sometimes. Plus you would have this thing dangling from your phone that you had to have in the right position to keep signal. I have now had this bluetooth fm product for about 2 months and have used it daily. With this bluetooth transmitter there are no wires! its very simple to move it with its bendy neck. When you hold the center button down it auto finds the best station and you just program your vehicle to that station and boom!
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: Have had it almost a year and it works good. Sometimes I have to turn off the power then turn it back on to get it to connect via Bluetooth, but that's the only problem. It has clear sound, simple buttons, and I love the fact I can talk without having to scream at it for the person on the other end of a phone call to hear me. It switches easily from music to a call when a call comes in, and goes back to music when the call is over. The only problem - you have to turn the radio way up to hear a phone call, then way back down when you go back to music.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Works Great, Superior to other gadgets of same type
customer_reviews.text: My husband says this works GREAT. He has tried two other gadgets like this and says this one is very superior. Updated post - we actually bought a second one. My husband used the first for his work truck, and was moving it to his personal truck for weekends and evenings. We got a second one so he wouldn't have to move it back and forth. They both work GREAT.
customer_reviews.author: BeJoyfulNow

customer_reviews.title: Great product - good warranty and excellent customer service
customer_reviews.text: Had mine for about a year and half. The display just stopped working in the past week. I read the warranty when I got this item - 3-year warranty (make sure you register within the first 30 days of owning it!!!), so I filed a warranty claim on their website a week or so ago, and got no response. I called their customer service number today - I have to say, hands down, the nicest customer service person I've dealt with in ages. Turns out they were having issues with their website the day I initiated the claim - they are taking care of getting everything out to me for warranty service this afternoon.
customer_reviews.author: KenInCLT

customer_reviews.title: Love it. I've had bad luck with FM Transmitters ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it. I've had bad luck with FM Transmitters in the past and this one works well on just about any station setting. It was easy to pair with my phone. I also use the Aux input frequently with a very old iPod and that works flawlessly. I even used the USB port to charge my son's Kindle Fire while we were driving. My 12v jack in the car doesn't turn off with the car so it's nice that it also has an on/off button so I don't need to remove it from the jack.
customer_reviews.author: S. Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use and clear audio!
customer_reviews.text: Our FM transmitter broke recently and a friend suggested this replacement. It is amazing how much better this device is compared with our other model. It is much clearer than our previous device and it is powerful enough to overpower stations that are actual live broadcast stations. We also love the fact that it has Bluetooth. Much cheaper than replacing the whole car stereo! Also, it is amazingly easy to setup! 1) Plug it in, hold down the "answer" button to start the Bluetooth pairing process. 2) Pair on your phone. 3) Set the station you want to broadcast to and dial in your car radio. 4) Then go!
customer_reviews.author: J. M. Hughvers

customer_reviews.title: So happy to cut the cord!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product! I was pretty tired of having to buy a new cassette tape adapter every few months when the cord would inevitably wear out, but alas, that was the only way to transmit audio from my phone through my car speakers. Needless to say, I was thrilled to find a Bluetooth option that allowed me to cut the cord! This thing works great - exactly as advertised. The only suggestion I can make to improve the product would be to add a memory card slot for MP3s and also consider making the USB slot functional in terms of reading data (not just charging).
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Beattie

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect! I love that I can pair two phones with it, and the best part about it is that the sound quality is BETTER than the actual radio. We played Pandora for a 12 hour car ride to visit family (total 24 hours,) and this device was amazing! Using it now as I type! If you hear static, its because there's a radio station next to thay setting. Just go to a new station, problem solved. This has only happened to us a couple of times. I was torn between this device or a cassette auxiliary adapter, and I made the right decision.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy23

customer_reviews.title: it looks like I am out side the return window by 4 ...
customer_reviews.text: It worked as advertised for four weeks, then died. The problem is not with the fuse. Considering that for the entire time it was plugged into the same power outlet, in the same position, the problem is also not from misuse. Clearly a defective item. And, it looks like I am out side the return window by 4 days so this is money wasted. I will not be buying one of these again. As a side note, I own another Gogroove unit just like this one, except that it is blue. That one I have used for years with no issues. Apparently the quality has declined sharply.
customer_reviews.author: Deude Mann

customer_reviews.title: Works as designed
customer_reviews.text: Has been a handy little gadget. Bought for my older truck that didn't have Bluetooth or USB cables. Ended up using the USB cord to power my phone. The radio part can be tricky if you're driving across quite a few states. Have to change frequencies on the fly as the station that isn't being used in one state might have a station in another. Works well for people who constantly switch vehicles.
customer_reviews.author: ScranScran

customer_reviews.title: Working great for me both music as well as phone calls
customer_reviews.text: Working great for me! Allows me to easily listen to Pandora in my car and I can skip a song, pause, and immediately answer a call. Pandora starts right back up when the call is over. Callers were complaining about the speakerphone quality on my phone which is the main reason I got this...and, it is working great. I can hear everyone perfectly through my car speakers and no problems with other people hearing me on the other end even while driving. I would definitely recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Andy W

customer_reviews.title: Great Solution
customer_reviews.text: I have an older boat stereo that doesn't have an aux port. I was about to purchase a new system when I found this option. I researched the device on line, and it got the highest reviews on every site I found. Yes, it's a great device. It's simple to use, the signal is strong, and the sound quality is excellent. So happy I can now stream my Spotify on the boat.
customer_reviews.author: RR

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth for the Bluetooth-less car
customer_reviews.text: Just hooked up this up today and it was super easy to use (didn't even bother reading the manual that came with it) and it works. I really like how the device allows you to manually scroll to channel that matches your local radio stations. I was able to use Pandora to play music via Bluetooth, which is what I wanted since my car does not have Bluetooth built into the stereo system. The only reason I didn't give it 5 starts was that the reception is not as crisp as the regular radio, not bad, but just not 100% crisp/clear. I guess you cannot have it all, but this gets you darn close!
customer_reviews.author: BeBe

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price!!
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price! Saw this at best but for about $200. Works well with my radio. Once in a while it will temporary stop working, I think it is due to the area where that particular radio frequency already has something on that station. Works well with iPhone 5s. The only thing that didn't work well was is my car is manual transmission and I occasionally bump it due to the long curvature base. The calling works pretty decently but talking into doesn't always work right due to the microphone being far away. Can't use the phone when the window is open. Shipped on time. Overall it is definately worth it
customer_reviews.author: Kaylee

customer_reviews.title: Loved the old one - hate this new one
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace one that I had for 10 years. This one did not have a strong enough transmitter. There was always static. My old one had a line out which avoided the static. This new one does not have it so it was useless to me.
customer_reviews.author: Cside

customer_reviews.title: Great idea.  Few problems with mine.
customer_reviews.text: Use it daily. It recognizes my iphone instantly. I have to turn it's volume up to 30 (max), start my iphone, then turn the volume up again. The number stays at 30, but the volume does go up. After several years the knob doesn't seem to react immediately or consistently. If you plug your phone in to charge you'll probably hear a whine through the speakers, as the alternator noise will be transmitted through the system. Same results for plugging in a device via the earphone jack.
customer_reviews.author: M&PK

customer_reviews.title: It works well for what it is, but it's still not ideal
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best FM Transmitters I've had the displeasure of using. It works well enough, but if you use wireless charging in your car it interferes with the signal a bit. If you don't use wireless charging, it will probably work just fine on a clear station. The sounds quality isn't great (it sounds a little thin), but it's a sight better than other FM Transmitters I've tried. I played with the Line-Out to a tape adapter and it did not work (the tape adapter works fine). If you're looking at it for that use, YMMV.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron R.

customer_reviews.title: Transformed my morning commute!
customer_reviews.text: Loveeeeeee this thing. I've been using this for well over 2 years at this point, daily on my morning commutes. It's more than paid for itself. It seamlessly connects to my phone as soon as I get in the car and the quality coming through my radio is good enough for me. I use it to stream podcasts/pandora/my music/spotify and it has transformed my commute from unbearable to enjoyable. Instead of listening to awful terrestrial radio, commercials and terrible pop songs, I have control of whatever content I want to listen to on that day. Plus it was a cheaper alternative than installing an entire new radio system in my car. 10/10 would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Larwheezy

customer_reviews.title: So Far, Good!
customer_reviews.text: What an awesome device! Quality is great - not flimsy and cheap like most transmitters. I only have some issues with static/signal when playing Pandora with my iPhone 5s but it could be the phone's service and data loading for streaming. Otherwise, plugging my regular iPod in seems fine thus far, as far as the audio goes. When I plug in my USB to charge my phone, the Flex itself gets a little hot and that kinda scares me but I run my ac aimed toward it so it won't overheat. It charges my phone fine though! It's been a few weeks with it and no major problems so far. I think it's a fine product!
customer_reviews.author: kcharn

customer_reviews.title: Take your device's audio files with you on the road without an audio system upgrade.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not particularly techy, but I get by. This device isn't too difficult to get running if you can operate a radio and know how to access bluetooth on your device. And it's not that hard to access, youtube it if you don't know. You do need to be sure to select a radio station which is not in use by any other area radio stations or your signal will get overwhelmed, but it works great if you've got an older car and no way to plug in your phone to listen to audio books or your own music selection. I've not regretted this purchace.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel E. Watkins

customer_reviews.title: Poor sound! There are better options!
customer_reviews.text: I just received the GOgroove and I was so excited to try it. For my surprise, this device has very poor strength. I tried it in all empty stations and all I heard was a very poor sound quality and a lot of static. I bought it because I currently have a VicTsing transmitter that cost me only 16$ and my old transmitter sound is way better than this one. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: shaggylovesoccer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty handy
customer_reviews.text: Product has worked well for almost three years. My car doesn't have a tape deck, so I figured this was the best solution. Periodically I will have to unplug and plug this adapter back in for the best sound quality, HOWEVER this could be an issue with my car's cigarette lighter, not this adapter.
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: Beyond Expectations!!
customer_reviews.text: This was recommended from a friend who uses this in his truck. I bought this for my Jeep Wrangler since my radio only had an Aux cord and it didn't work well. This unit is a game changer for me!! Everyone can hear me clearly, even on the highway. So easy to set up and use. I highly recommend this unit for Bluetooth operations! 5-3-18 I have just bought a second one!! I am very happy with this product!!
customer_reviews.author: ce4tnkr

customer_reviews.title: Great Bluetooth transmitter/receiver
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for a friend who has an older pickup truck which has no auxiliary jack, USB port or Bluetooth. The truck does have a cassette player but it does not function well so the cassette adapter option didn't work out. I did a lot of reviews before deciding on this one. My friend claimed the reception is very good. He said he can delay getting a new car receiver with this.
customer_reviews.author: Annie Wong

customer_reviews.title: Broken after 1 month
customer_reviews.text: This item broke after 1 month. It is not a quality item that should cost 45 dollars. I was also unable to return it because it was past the 1 month deadline. :( Update 10/21: "Accessory power" commented on this feedback and stated they wanted to help me get a replacement. But they denied my warranty claim because the seller is not an "authorized seller". So they did not help replace their faulty, defective item that broke after 1 month and cost me 45 dollars.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: I wish it was a little better
customer_reviews.text: Pros: *Easy to use. *Completely wireless interface between your Smartphone and Car Radio. *Decent performance for the price, given the limited choice of devices that provide a link to your FM radio. Cons: *Output volume transmitted to your radio isn't equal to the average radio station. I have to turn the radio volume WAY up to get a decent level. *Still a bit of intermittent static on the FM signal, no mater what frequency it's operating on. I'm constantly moving it around to try to eliminate the interference. This problem may have been insignificant if the output level was higher. I might have been able to keep the radio volume turned down and possibly mask the static.
customer_reviews.author: Blues Monkey

customer_reviews.title: Consistent convenience, good UI ease-of-use
customer_reviews.text: I like its quick connection and the announcement of same upon vehicle startup. Very easy to maneuver to new frequencies. The phone connection feature is a little less than great, but I'm not sure if any of these devices with such remote microphones could be very good.
customer_reviews.author: Chasseur

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth for a non-bluetooth stereo
customer_reviews.text: If your car stereo doesnt have bluetooth built into it, this is your solution. I have been using this particular device for a year (or more) now, its well built and the sound quality is very good bordering on excellent. Pro's: custom frequency selection (any number on the fm dial), sound quality is great, has a built in volume control (I keep mine at about 24 and let my phone do the rest), an external usb port for charging (if your going ot use your bluetooth, gps and maps, your battery isnt going to last long without charging), play/call controls for your bluetooth device, external mini jack input. Cons: cant think of any, especially at this price.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: It's a very functional device for the price... so far.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good product that I've had for four months now. The factory USB cable is cheap and was discarded after just a few uses, but if you have an old USB that fits your phone, just place it in the port and it'll work fine. When traveling, you may have to change channels by scanning for an open frequency, because you'll get feedback, at times. On daily commutes within the same metro area, there should be little difficulty. Also, sometimes, it doesn't like cold mornings, which can require several re-boots and some time to get the device up and running. It's a very functional device for the price... so far.
customer_reviews.author: Counsellor

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: Works well and easy to use. Bought one in March of 2013 that died, thus 1 less star. Decided to get the same version because it's the best one we've tried. It keeps the connection better than others, easy to change channels to try a different one if needed (particularly when traveling). Has a USB plug on the side for the phone.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Pitt

customer_reviews.title: No clear signal in Seattle
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this working for me based on all of the positive reviews, but while driving around Seattle and between Seattle and Portland, I am constantly re-tuning to try to find an open station. I've had it since July 2012, and I've never gotten it to work consistently. I'm assuming that how well this works depends largely on the density of radio stations. I'm really sick of hearing static and trying to re-tune this while driving, so I'm springing for an integrated AUX kit from GTA. It's twice the price of the FlexSMART, but it's a direct line into the stereo without relying on a clear frequency and shouldn't be terribly difficult to install.
customer_reviews.author: M. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but really good!
customer_reviews.text: A bit pricey, but the best sound quality of the ones I've heard or personally tried. Only thing I don't like about this new model is that I can't get it to reconnect if I walk away from my vehicle long enough for it to disconnect. I have to either go into Bluetooth settings and re-connect or cycle the power of the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Dagoberto Reyes

customer_reviews.title: Good unit
customer_reviews.text: Love this FM Transmitter, use this in my work truck all day long. It's just what I needed to listen to my Music from my cell phone through the work trucks speakers since there is no AUX jack or Bluetooth available. It keeps the phone charged at the same time, and since you can pick your own blank radio channels to use, there is very little static that I run into. We share trucks at work, so at the end of the day I just pull it out of the lighter and take it home with me. Have been using it steady for a couple years now and have had no problems at all, best FM transmitter I have used.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen C.

customer_reviews.title: Top choice from Wirecutter
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good device! I ordered this model because it was rated well on Wire cutter. Does not disappoint. The Bluetooth connection works great. Sound quality is good but can’t be great using any fm transmitter. It depends on the radio station you choose. This is definitely the best transmitter I have used. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: morgan

customer_reviews.title: Functional, startup is less than ideal
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this product is as you would expect. The quality was good, and everything that can be adjusted is adjustable, which is a plus. However, if your phone is not enabled when the transmitter is turned on, it will not connect unless you turn the transmitter off and back on. For price, that is expected and does not hinder usability much.
customer_reviews.author: Alec Chappell

customer_reviews.title: Vehicle Bluetooth, thats worth a try!
customer_reviews.text: This product is portable which means you can move it to other vehicles. The product has exceeded my expectations, it allows hands free phone conversations which I wasn't expecting. There is a slight/faint hissing which fades during music playback but its not a deal breaker. The fact that there are no wires and I have streaming music through my stereo for road trips has been awesome.I recommend this product as a must buy for vehicle owners whose radios do not have Bluetooth capabilities.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Jay

customer_reviews.title: Happy with purchase
customer_reviews.text: I use this daily driving truck. If its durable enough for a truck that shakes and rattles, it is definitely good for car use. Pairing is super easy. I've used it for phone calls and streaming music. The next song/rewind as well as play/pause buttons work nice with my android phone. not sure about apple devices. I have been through a few of these type devices and this one STAYS PUT unlike others that seems to fall out of cig lighter. Output volume is louder and stronger FM signal than others i have had.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle C.

customer_reviews.title: ... grainy and it makes any song with bass sound terrible. The quality with calls is great though
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is grainy and it makes any song with bass sound terrible. The quality with calls is great though. I would recommend this for hands free calling but not for playing music via bluetooth. UPDATE: this no longer works. It is connected/paired properly but even with my radio's volume up to maximum I can hardly hear music playing from my phone. Making calls with it is now impossible. It's not even a year since purchase and it's already not working. Very disappointed with this purchase- DO NOT BUY THIS!
customer_reviews.author: LilMissMalone

customer_reviews.title: Great item, make much happy.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this adapter, it has a charge port for usb devices and audio input for your non bluetooth devices. The adapter has a power switch at the base to turn it all the way off without unplugging. It offers easy search for channel to connect to or for you to pick the best one. Pause, next, previous for music and call and answer buttons. The mic is in the unit so if you put it in the center console you may not be heard so well as when in other outlets. I really enjoy this item and glad to have it. The transmission is really good in comparison to many other transmitters I have used.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Lynn Morton II

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.text: This is better than I imagined. I bought it so I could listen to Pandora in my truck. I love the way it links up automatically upon ignition and how all of the controls are on the device. As long as my Pandora App or Google Music are open on the phone, I never have to get the phone out of my pocket while driving and can use all of the features of the phone and apps. Definitely worth the price and I am considering buying one for my wife's car so that I don't have to switch this one back and forth for road trips.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Buysalot

customer_reviews.title: Not a perfect solution, but a good one
customer_reviews.text: It performs as advertised. However... 1) If you find yourself in a fairly population dense area, you might have trouble finding an empty channel on your radio to stream to. 2) If you use dictation for texting, it doesn't do so well. Phone calls are ok. 3) If you turn it off, the usb cable you attached to it stops charging your device (so just leave it on, and turn off the radio when not using it). Not a perfect solution, but a good one, and much cheaper than a radio replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S.

customer_reviews.title: Love this!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband who has an older 4-Runner without Bluetooth. He was carrying around a Bluetooth speaker that needed to be charged every couple of days and it just wasn't convenient. I found and ordered this for him, we plugged it in, found an empty station and linked his phone. Super easy and works great! I talk to him on the phone through this all of the time and it sounds just fine. I was a little worried from other reviews, but to me, this works great for both music and talking on the phone. I would definitely recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: Terri Boroviak

customer_reviews.title: Solid purchase!
customer_reviews.text: For several years I have been happy with my Belkin FM transmitter compatible to an iPhone 3GS. But getting a consistently clean signal was not always a sure thing in some areas or other vehicles. Right away I was amazed by the clear sound I was receiving with my FlexSMART, and the fact that i did not have to crank up the car's volume to an excessive degree. I also liked the flexibility of plugging in a USB charging line into the side of the transmitter, or the ability to use any bluetooth-capable device. I consider this purchase well worth what I paid for it, given my daily use of it.
customer_reviews.author: C. D. Patrick

product_meta.title: GOgroove FlexSMART X2 Bluetooth FM Transmitter for Car Radio w/USB Charging, Multipoint Pairing, Music Controls, Hands Free Microphone - Sync with Smartphones, Android (Updated 2019 Version)
feature_bullets: CONNECT YOUR SMARTPHONE so you can listen to audio through your car speakers | ON-BOARD CONTROLS for easy accessibility includes Volume , Bluetooth pairing , Call buttons for safe driving on the road
MULTIPOINT BLUEOOTH CONNECTIVITY pairs 2 devices simultaneously so you can take calls & stream audio from either! Trade off DJ'ing and have both your personal & business phones synced!
BUILT-IN MICROPHONE with enhanced voice detection makes hands-free calls easy - plug-in, sync your phone, and you’re ready to talk!
USB CHARGING PORT lets you power up your device while talking or streaming music! Compact, innovative design and flexible neck ensure an ideal fit in nearly any vehicle
FREE 3 YEAR WARRANTY - TECH SPECS: Bluetooth Version: V2.1 / Bluetooth Profiles: HSP, HFP, A2DP, & AVRCP / Frequency Range: 88.1 – 107.9 MHz / Input: DC 12V (Vehicle Power) / USB Output: 5V 1A max

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars10,625 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
